```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
library(dplyr)
library(readr)
library(ggplot2)
library(patchwork)
```




```{r echo = FALSE, message=FALSE}
df <- 
  list.files(path="./Simresult1/AIC", full.names = TRUE) %>% 
  lapply(read_csv) %>% 
  dplyr::bind_rows() %>% 
  as_tibble() %>% 
  janitor::clean_names() %>% 
  dplyr::arrange(number) %>% 
   mutate(
    s1_prop = s1_selected/s1,
    s2_prop = s2_selected/25,
    s3_prop = s3_selected/s3
  )

```

```{r echo = FALSE, warning=FALSE}
# summary by method for aic
summary1_df = df %>% 
  group_by(method) %>% 
  summarize(
    avg_s1_prop = mean(s1_prop),
    avg_s2_prop = mean(s2_prop),
    avg_s3_prop = mean(s3_prop)
) %>% 
  knitr::kable(caption = "The performance of AIC variable selection by method")
summary1_df

# summary by n for aic
summary2_df = df %>% 
  group_by(n) %>% 
  summarize(
    avg_s1_prop = mean(s1_prop),
    avg_s2_prop = mean(s2_prop),
    avg_s3_prop = mean(s3_prop)
) %>% 
  knitr::kable(caption = "The performance of AIC variable selection by n")
summary2_df

# summary by p for aic
summary3_df = df %>% 
  group_by(p) %>% 
  summarize(
    avg_s1_prop = mean(s1_prop),
    avg_s2_prop = mean(s2_prop),
    avg_s3_prop = mean(s3_prop)
) %>% 
  knitr::kable(caption = "The performance of AIC variable selection by p")
summary3_df

# summary by n & p for aic
summary4_df = df %>% 
  group_by(n,p) %>% 
  summarize(
    avg_s1_prop = mean(s1_prop),
    avg_s2_prop = mean(s2_prop),
    avg_s3_prop = mean(s3_prop)
) %>% 
  knitr::kable(caption = "The performance of AIC variable selection by n&p")
summary4_df
# conclusion: when n = 100, with p increasing, the success selection proportion in all three signals will firstly increase and then decrease,however, when p fix, there is no big differnce between n = 100 and n =200.

# visulization
prop_plot = df %>% 
  group_by(n,p) %>% 
  summarize(
    avg_s1_prop = mean(s1_prop),
    avg_s2_prop = mean(s2_prop),
    avg_s3_prop = mean(s3_prop)
)  %>% 
  filter(n == 100) %>% 
  pivot_longer(
    avg_s1_prop:avg_s3_prop,
    names_to = "signals",
    values_to = "avg_proportion"
  ) %>% 
    separate(signals, sep= "_", into = c("avg","signal","prop")) %>% select(-avg, - prop) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = p, y = avg_proportion, color = signal)) + 
  geom_line() +
  labs(y = "Average proportion", 
       x = "Number of predictors", 
       title = "Proportion of three signals vs P")
prop_plot
  
# summary by corr for aic
summary5_df = df %>% 
  group_by(corr) %>% 
  summarize(
    avg_s1_prop = mean(s1_prop),
    avg_s2_prop = mean(s2_prop),
    avg_s3_prop = mean(s3_prop)
) %>% 
  knitr::kable(caption = "The performance of AIC variable selection by correlation")
summary5_df

# summary by beta for aic
summary6_df = df %>% 
  group_by(beta) %>% 
  summarize(
    avg_s1_prop = mean(s1_prop),
    avg_s2_prop = mean(s2_prop),
    avg_s3_prop = mean(s3_prop)
) %>% 
  knitr::kable(caption = "The performance of AIC variable selection by beta")
summary6_df

# summary by non-selected for aic (elective)
summary7_df = df %>% 
  group_by(n,p) %>% 
  summarize(
    white_noise = mean(no_selected)
) %>% 
  knitr::kable(caption = "The performance of AIC variable selection by white noise")
summary7_df

# summary by n,p,method for aic
prop_method_plot = df %>% 
  group_by(n,p,method) %>% 
  summarize(
    avg_s1_prop = mean(s1_prop),
    avg_s2_prop = mean(s2_prop),
    avg_s3_prop = mean(s3_prop)
) %>% 
  filter(n == 100) %>% 
  pivot_longer(
    avg_s1_prop:avg_s3_prop,
    names_to = "signals",
    values_to = "avg_proportion"
  ) %>% 
    separate(signals, sep= "_", into = c("avg","signal","prop")) %>% select(-avg, - prop) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = p, y = avg_proportion, color =signal)) + 
  geom_smooth(se = FALSE) + 
  facet_grid(method~ .) +
  labs(y = "Average proportion", 
       x = "Number of predictors", 
       title = "Proportion of three signals vs P-AIC")
prop_method_plot

df1_plot = df %>% 
  filter(method == 1) 

aic_11 = ggplot(df1_plot,aes(x = s1_prop)) + geom_histogram() + labs(title = "AIC Method 1 for s1 selection proportion")
aic_21 = ggplot(df1_plot,aes(x = s2_prop)) + geom_histogram() + labs(title = "AIC Method 1 for s2 selection proportion")
aic_31 = ggplot(df1_plot,aes(x = s3_prop)) + geom_histogram() + labs(title = "AIC Method 1 for s3 selection proportion")




df2_plot = df %>% 
  filter(method == 2) 
 
aic_12 = ggplot(df2_plot,aes(x = s1_prop)) + geom_histogram() + labs(title = "AIC Method 2 for s1 selection proportion")
aic_22 = ggplot(df2_plot,aes(x = s2_prop)) + geom_histogram() + labs(title = "AIC Method 2 for s2 selection proportion")
aic_32 = ggplot(df2_plot,aes(x = s3_prop)) + geom_histogram() + labs(title = "AIC Method 2 for s3 selection proportion")


df3_plot = df %>% 
  filter(method == 3) 
 
aic_13 = ggplot(df3_plot,aes(x = s1_prop)) + geom_histogram() + labs(title = "AIC Method 2 for s1 selection proportion")
aic_23 = ggplot(df3_plot,aes(x = s2_prop)) + geom_histogram() + labs(title = "AIC Method 2 for s2 selection proportion")
aic_33 = ggplot(df3_plot,aes(x = s3_prop)) + geom_histogram() + labs(title = "AIC Method 2 for s3 selection proportion")
```

```{r echo = FALSE,  warning=FALSE}
aic_11+aic_12+aic_13
aic_21+aic_22+aic_23
aic_31+aic_32+aic_33
```
